intro: Jatropha angustifolia var. spathulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf jatropha, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a hardy and adaptable species.
